Posted By: Salient (8/25/2011 2:56:56 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Horsemanship: The flavor text is supposed to be terrible. The concept is fine, although a little out-of-place as the only non-black, green Lycanthrope. And I'd wonder what you'd define as an ability that does make sense; it's a druid that goes into bear-rage when your stuff is dead.  
  
If you take threshold on the symbolic level; an abundance of death, it makes absolute sense that a druid who previously spent his time producing mana and being a hippie would start raging with Giant Growth(a ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) card, don't forget) once the destruction of what he loves and protects reaching a certain limit.  
Let's not forget that it's fairly typical in most fantasy games (WoW aside, please) for druids to turn into woodland creatures, such as bears; which are usually depicted as highly spiritual among most old animist cultures.  
  
It would have made more sense if he wasn't a bear until you got the threshold, but, oh well. It's always nice to give your llanawars a break and throw in a man with some late-game ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
@Horsemanship: The flavor text is supposed to be terrible. The concept is fine, although a little out-of-place as the only non-black, green Lycanthrope. And I'd wonder what you'd define as an ability that does make sense; it's a druid that goes into bear-rage when your stuff is dead.

If you take threshold on the symbolic level; an abundance of death, it makes absolute sense that a druid who previously spent his time producing mana and being a hippie would start raging with Giant Growth(a card, don't forget) once the destruction of what he loves and protects reaching a certain limit.
Let's not forget that it's fairly typical in most fantasy games (WoW aside, please) for druids to turn into woodland creatures, such as bears; which are usually depicted as highly spiritual among most old animist cultures.

It would have made more sense if he wasn't a bear until you got the threshold, but, oh well. It's always nice to give your llanawars a break and throw in a man with some late-game ... (see all)
